headline: CNN News Central
subHeadline: Key Witness Testifies Amid Effort To Boot Trump Prosecutor. Aired 2:30-3p ET

utterances.speaker: ASHLEIGH MERCHANT, DEFENSE ATTORNEY FOR MIKE ROMAN
utterances.sentences: That's what I'm asking you.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I can't remember whether it was text, phone, or --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: But you recall us speaking one way or another?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: One way or another, yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And while I was trying to confirm the facts in that filing?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I think I remember there was a line of -- about the accuracy of how much money that my office, the law -- the law office of Terrence Bradley, had received. And whether or not that was going to be in the motion or not.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: There wasn't a discrepancy (INAUDIBLE). You asked me to put that back in, correct?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I don't -- I recall you -- that may be accurate? Yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: You thought -- because you thought it might be suspicious if you were left out of the motion?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: No. I think -- we discussed that it should reflect the accuracy because the accuracy was that I received -- I had a contract and received 74 grand, $74,000.And I think you had put in there that Mr. Campbell had received a certain amount. And then you also have put in there that Mr. Wade had received certain amount. But there was not anything in there originally. And I said that it needs to be accurate. I needed to be accurate as far as that I have received $74,000.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: That is correct.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Because you did not want anyone knowing that you had talked to me?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: Object. That's to relevance.

utterances.speaker: JUDGE SCOTT MCAFEE, FULTON COUNTY, GA, SUPERIOR COURT
utterances.sentences: Bias. (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I wanted you to be accurate as far as the accuracy of our message or your filing.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. So that was your -- your interest wasn't inaccuracy in the filing?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I didn't reach out to you and say send me a copy of your motion.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I didn't reach out to you to say that you were -- that I'm going to be in your motion.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Right. I asked you to review it for accuracy.

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: For accuracy. And I just stated that it was inaccurate.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And the inaccuracy that you pointed out was the thing about this or how much you would make?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: That was the inaccuracy that I saw that jumped out, was the fact that I saw that I was left out when you and put --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: -- the firm that moneywise.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I did not -- I did not -- when I responded to that, it was for that specific reason.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. And I agreed that I would put that back in, that section back in --

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: -- and I did put it back. And I sent it to you again.

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I don't recall getting a second email from, you know.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: But you were happy that I put it back in or that I agreed to put it back in?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: Object as to relevance.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Yes. We need to get through more material aspects.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Yes, Judge. I am moving along. I promise.So you asked me -- you did ask me to put that back in?

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Well, an answer (INAUDIBLE), it needs an answer to that last question. So you will --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: You did -- can you confirm you did ask me to put that back in, for it to be accurate?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's correct. I said that -- yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. And then I asked you if everything was accurate and you said looks good. Correct?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: I -- I recall you asking that, but that looks good was applying to the accuracy of the 74,000. That's it.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. So when you reviewed the motion and you specifically pointed out that one thing that you found inaccurate, you didn't point anything else out that you found inaccurate in that motion though, correct?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: No, I did not.

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: If I can read -- reread the motion. But I don't recall. But if that's what he says. But I didn't -- my saying that it looks good was when you put back in the 74,000 into your motion.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. And that's that wasn't what I was asking.What I was asking is, you didn't tell me that there was anything else inaccurate in the motion, right?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: But I didn't state that anything was accurate, other than the 74,000.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Now when I told you that I had this motion that I was preparing, you asked me to send a rough draft?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: No, that's incorrect.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: May I approach, Judge?

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Direct?What page are you showing?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: The page number, it's January 6th --(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Yes, of course.And all the time.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: So we've been talking, you asked me to send you a rough draft, and I told you, OK, but I didn't want it to be leaked before I filed it. Right?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: That is correct, yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: So you're the one that asked me to send a rough draft?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's correct. Yes, that's correct.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And that was at 10

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: You can even look at it.

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: If -- if it says 10

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: While he's looking at it, I'm going to object as to asked and answered. We've been through the fact that he set up a copy of the motion, whether it said rough draft or not, and then asked about the accuracies, explained his answer.And I've checked.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: I ask you, understand, we're getting there.Overruled for now.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And then I responded, when we were talking about that, that we were talking about, I said, I took it I took it out, but I can add it back. And you said, yes, add it back. Do you remember that?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I answered that, yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And then I said, anything else? Anything that's -- and you responded, looks good. You were all that?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: Let me see the --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: There -- I don't know where the exhibits are. They were submitted.That refresh your memory?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: It says looks good, but as -- as I stated before, I was responding to you putting me back into the motion for receiving $74,000 in a contract. MERCHANTSo you weren't responding to put it back in?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: And I'm going to object. I know his motion. He wasn't the affiant of the most verified.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Overruled. Mr. Bonny (ph).

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I've said twice

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Overruled, Mr. Bonny (ph).

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I've said twice that it looks accurate was -- or I've said more than twice, was for the $74,000.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Do you remember telling me about Nathan and Fani coming to your office and spending time together at your office?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: No, I've mentioned -- I do recall testifying on the 16th that she had come to her office.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And that was before she was elected as district attorney, correct?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I recall that was when she was district attorney because I said that there was a meeting held at my office.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And who was at that meeting?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: Now I can't tell you that. I don't recall.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: But you know Ms. Willis was there and Mr. Wade was there?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: It was at our office. Actually, Ms. Willis was there and there were other people there. Mr. Wade was not in that meeting. He was -- he was in the back. I wasn't even in that meeting.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Why did she hold it at your office?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: You also remember telling me about them spending time together at her law office before she took -- took her job?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I don't recall. Do you -- I don't recall. Do you have something to --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Well, what I'm asking is -- so let's backup. So Ms. Willis rented a law office from Evans, from Andrew Evans and another lawyer, I think Stacy Evans. You have knowledge of that, correct?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: No, I'm going to object to hearsay.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: If --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: Well, how does he know the information? That'll be the correct question.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: OK. Ms. Merchant

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: I don't really know even how to respond to that, hearsay. I'm asking if he knew that she rented the --

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: They may have been there. I mean --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Maybe seen a business card or something at some point, I think he can answer that.

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I've never been to Ms. Willis' office when she was in private practice. I've never dealt with where she rented. I didn't even know where her office was. So --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Do you remember. though, knowing that she rented an office --

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: -- from the others?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Did you notice --

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes, that is correct? Yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. And do you remember telling me that Mr. Wade and Ms. Willis would rendezvous at that office?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: I'm going to again, hearsay as to how he knows that information. He said he has no personal knowledge.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: He did not say he has no personal knowledge. He hasn't even answered it.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: He said in general he had no personal knowledge so it's not been established a source of how he would know this because he said he's never been to her office.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: All right.Ms. Merchant, if you -- if you -- I know you're trying to impeach him by a prior inconsistent statement, but unless you can first back up and show why each statement is actually something that knowledge of -- I don't know if this is going to be relevant.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And, Judge, I'm not even there yet. But again, speaking objection. And so now I would anticipate what our response is going to be next. I didn't ask anything that was objectionable.But these objections are coaching the witness. I asked if he had knowledge. That's it. I didn't ask, did someone say this to you? I didn't ask, what did this person tell you? I asked if he knew.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Well, no, you're asking if he had knowledge and then you say of something specific. So --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Once I get an answer to that, if he has knowledge, then I will follow up with where that knowledge came from.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: All right, let's try again.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: So my question is, do you have knowledge of them meeting at that office? Objection. Foundation.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Objection. Foundation.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: OK. All right. Overruled.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Do you have knowledge of them meeting at that office?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I have no personal knowledge if that's what you're asking.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: I didn't ask that yet. I asked if you have any knowledge?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: Objection. That would be hearsay.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Overruled.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Not if it came from Mr.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: We don't know where it came from. So he said -- how do you know Mr. Bradley?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: How do you know?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: Any knowledge that I would have received would have come from my client at the time.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. So you had knowledge of this place that Ms. Willis worked. What did you know about them meeting at that office?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: Objection. Hearsay.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: It's not hearsay, Judge.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Overruled.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: How he knows it. And then you ask the next question.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: She's -- she's already asked the next question.

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: Can you read the question?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Yes. How do you have knowledge? What knowledge did -- well, you just told us. You told us Mr. Wade told you. So tell us what Mr. Wade told you about Ms. Willis and Mr. Wade meeting at the office?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: Objection, Your Honor, privilege. This clearly covers the time after December 2018 that's covered by privilege.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Yes. Overruled.Do you recall the question, Mr. Bradley?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I do not.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: You may re-ask the question, Ms. Merchant.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: What did you learn from Mr. Wade? I would clarify that's where you learned about Mr. Willis -- Mr. Wade and Ms. Willis meeting at Evan's office together.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: I'll object to asked and answered. He's testified that --(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: It wasn't answered. I haven't -- we haven't heard an answer.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: He testified he had one conversation with Mr. Wade in the back of his law office.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Yes, and his answer may change. So as to --(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: -- office what -- how to answer the question.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Mr. Wade told you that they had sex with an office, is that correct?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I don't recall him saying that, no.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: You don't recall?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: So it's possible he did say that?You don't remember one way or another?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I do not remember him saying that.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Do you recall that he had a garage door opener to either a house or a condo or something like that of Ms. Willis?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I've never seen a garage door opener. I've never been to Ms. Willis' house.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I've never been to -- and I'm trying to explain. I've never been. So, no, I do not have any personal knowledge of him having a garage door opener.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Let me ask the question again.

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: If you had personal knowledge, as you saw. Do you have any knowledge at all from Mr. Wade or any source, that he had a garage door opening to access one of Ms. Willis' residences?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: I'll object to any sources to hearsay.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: All right. Depends on the source. Overruled.

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: No. No, I don't have any knowledge.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: So when you told me that, did you just make it up?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: Do you have something that shows that I told you that?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Yes. We -- well, we're going to go through all the texts we can. But do you -- was that made up though?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: I'm an object that because --

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I don't recall him having --(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: -- one, zero, six, the rule completeness. I don't have that text message or any text messages that indicate that, Your Honor.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And I don't have if it was a text. We had that conversation -- I actually think it was when he was on speakerphone with Mr. Merchan there. I'm not sure. But I mean -- if I'm asked to qualify exactly where that's from, I would --

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: OK. So rule of completeness would be if you need to introduce other texts to show the context, if you're saying you don't -- I haven't seen a copy yet. And I think Ms. Merchant needs to do that before you can decide the next step.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And that's -- that's what I was asking him. If he -- if that was something he just remembers making up. If he doesn't, then that's fine. But --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: He referenced text message and started to go into her packet of paper.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Sure.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: That attack --

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: So you don't have a text message to that?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: I don't. I would need some time to look through and I don't remember if I have a text to that or if it was during a conversation? It was one of those.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Well, he has now said that he has no knowledge. So onto your next question.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK.Did Mr. Wade tell you about the trips that he and Ms. Willis took?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Do you have any knowledge of the trips that he and Ms. Willis took?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: Objection. Hearsay.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Overruled.

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I do now.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. But you did not before this proceeding?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I did not know until you texted that you found that in the deposition of his divorce. I may not -- not deposition, but something from his divorce.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK.And when you responded, "Doesn't surprise me. They took many trips to Florida, Texas, California." Those are your words, though, right?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: I'm going to object. That's irrelevant.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: He did not know and he actually learned from Ms. Merchant the information.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: He said he learned about certain trips from Ms. Merchant.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: OK. You can tie it down, but --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: We'll see.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: You have no information about any trip that Ms. Willis and Mr. Wade took, that he learned it all from Ms. Merchant. That was his testimony.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Sure.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Judge. I'm allowed to --(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: -- any conclusion we reach. I think she's going to ask more than one question though.All right, Ms. Merchant?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And if, Judge, just so we can be clear, if he said more than one version, that's all relevant. We're allowed to talk about the different versions that he's told.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: I've overruled the objection, Ms. Merchant.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Thank you.Do you remember telling me that it didn't surprise you that they took the trips that I found in the divorce file because they took many trips to Florida, Texas, California? And then you told me that they took the trip to California when she moved her daughter there because she failed at a FMU (ph)? Do you remember that?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I don't recall that, but if -- I don't recall.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK.Judge, may I approach? It's --

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Sure.

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: So when you

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Just -- just, first, let me know if that refreshes your memory?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: So it's true that you told me that they took money to support (ph), correct?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: Per that, yes. But one of the messages is cut off. And you asked about some of the trips. And I said, no, I didn't think, and that was specific to -- at the top of that, it says, no, I didn't.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: And so that was to the trips that you asked me about. And I think, before that, when you mentioned that you found all these trips, I think I said, oh, wow.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: You did. You did not know about all the trips that were taken. And you qualified it. You said, no, I didn't, when did it happen? And then in the next batch (INAUDIBLE) whatever -- whatever refreshes your memory.You said was accurate after you -- after the phone was resolved, correct?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: Object to relevance.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Overruled.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: It was after the firm -- that the trips that you said, no, you didn't know about. You told me those were after your firm after you had left, correct?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I think you mentioned that they were after I left maybe. or whenever you found him and I said, no, I didn't know about those trips. So --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: So you believe that I mentioned that it was after you left?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I'm quite sure you have the text message and I will refresh my memory.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Is it easier for you to refresh your memory with your own phone or with my printouts of screenshots?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: Well, you have the printout, so either.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Judge, the reason I'm asking is because I'm getting objections that I've cut things off. And it's just the nature of how you have to pronounce screenshots. So in order to avoid that, I'm happy for him to refresh his memorywith his own phone, if that would be --

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: I don't know if he's accepting your offer or not. So you --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Would that be easier for you?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: You can just provide the documents.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK.Let's see.

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: Perhaps the (INAUDIBLE).(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Yes, I'm sorry. I just I'm just kind of bring up all of the messages that can make --

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: All right. Well, I don't really see -- at some point, we're reaching the cumulative point where we don't need to go through an entire six-month text chain.You're making the point that he'd made some comments to you along the way that led you to believe he had more knowledge than today he's testifying that he had. And so, if you've hit the high points of that, then I don't know what else we can cover that actually moves the needle.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Right.I'll just - I'll move on to the (INAUDIBLE). So you told me that they took many trips to Florida. That refresh your memory? You told me that. Was that based on your knowledge from Mr. Wade?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: That would have been based on anything that my client would have told me. I didn't have personal knowledge of whether they went or not.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: The trip to Texas, from text messages, was that based on your knowledge from Mr. Wade?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: It would have been something that came from the client. I cannot tell you that I have any personal knowledge of any trip other than what would have been said by the client?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Obviously. I'm not asking you if he went on his trips. I'm asked me if you have knowledge of the trip. You also typed "California."Was that something that you gained knowledge from Mr. Wade?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: It would have been from the client at this particular point, yes, from the client.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: It would move from the trip to California was with the daughter on that? Would that have been something you heard from Mr. Wade?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: Thank you.Any knowledge that I have any trip would have come from my client at the time.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: You told us last week that Mr. Wade used your credit card one time. Do you know when that was?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I do not.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: Relevance, that's why we're here today.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Well, I think this would be an impeachment as to Mr. Wade's testimony that Mr. Wade testified that had never used anyone else's credit card before.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: I object to asked and answered because it was covered during the last year. It's been acknowledged that Mr. Wade used his credit card.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: So if I ask when I did when I didn't ask --(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Asked when. OK.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: I didn't ask did he. I asked, when did he?

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Let's go there/(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: But he used it for a trip?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes, it -- I mean, it was for trip, but I can't tell you where, when, why or anything to that nature, correct.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And he paid you back in cash?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I never testified that he paid me back in cash. I said that he would either pay me back -- you know, I said I couldn't remember. I do not recall.Sometimes he will write checks. Sometimes he will pay cash. And that still applies today that I do not recall him paying me back cash, but I do recall him paying me back.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: This was when you were still -- before your partnerships split up, correct?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: It would've been before I left the firm, yes. Even if he used my card after I left the firm.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: So we can at least narrow down the dates to that?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: Of before I left the firm, yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. Great.Mr. Wade gave you details about meeting Ms. Willis in Hapeville or East Point, as it was called?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: That's incorrect.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: He did not tell you about that?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: He didn't give me details

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: He did not tell you about meeting with Ms. Willis at an East Point or Hapeville apartment?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: At this time, I don't recall. No, I don't recall.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Where did you get that information from then?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: It's just that he doesn't recall it or even have that information.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: I asked if he got it from Mr. Wade and he says he doesn't recall. So then I asked where he got it from.

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: But now I don't recall where I got the information from.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK.And you and Mr. Wade were friends as well as business partners, correct?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: We were friends in the sense I've known him for years. Yes, we were friends.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And you definitely did not want to come and be a witness in this case, correct?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: That is correct.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And it was after -- and we talked about this earlier -- that Gabe Banks called you and then Nathan Wade called one of your friends. It was after that that you hired Mr. Chopra, to assist you in this matter, correct?

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: Was it after that?So I heard Mr. Chopra and I heard Mr. Graham. Now, Mr. Graham is here. And when I received this subpoena -- Mr. Graham was here at the last hearing, but he also had to go out of town, but he was president. Mr. Graham called and I started getting calls from media and -- and I told him to respond to the media, I think, and that was somewhere around whenever you subpoenaed me. So it was -- I can't tell you that it was that instance of those calls for Mr. Chopra but I had engaged Mr. Chopra and Mr. Graham at that time.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. I'm going to ask the question again because I didn't get an answer to it.After you got the phone call from Gabe Banks and from Nathan Wade, do you think it was --

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I think it was before that. But, however, I think it was before that is what I'm stating.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: When you got the call from Gabe Banks, you called me immediately. Well, actually, you texted me and then you called me.

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: I didn't call you immediately. But, yes, we did speak.

utterances.speaker: BRADLEY
utterances.sentences: That is correct.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And then we spoke after Mr. Wade called your friend. And we talked about that as well, correct?
